description:
You might think skipping an hour of sleep to hit the gym will result in weight loss.你可能会觉得少睡一个小时并用这个小时去健身房的话就能够减肥。

But new research suggests changing your sleep routine can cause you to pile on the pounds.但最新研究表明，作息时间的改变可能会让人变胖。

Sleeping for even one hour less a day causes us to eat more than usual, according to a study.根据这项研究结果，我们一天哪怕只少睡了一个小时就可能会吃的比平时多

And an extra hour - as unlikely as that may be for many of us - also has the same detrimental effect. 如果多睡一个小时，虽然对我们大多数来说并不太可能，但也会导致同样的结果。

Researchers looked at figures from 342 teenagers and analysed their sleeping habits. On average, they slept about seven hours every night.研究人员342名青少年的一些数据以及睡眠习惯等进行了分析。发现他们每晚的平均睡眠时间为7个小时。

However, when the amount of time teenagers slept varied by just an hour - either less or more - they ate, on average, an extra 201 calories per day.那些睡眠时间比平均值多或少1个小时的青少年们，平均每天会比其他人多摄入201卡路里的食物。

This is the equivalent of a bagel or two scoops of chocolate ice cream.这相当于一块硬面包圈或两小铲巧克力冰淇淋球的卡路里含量。

Disrupted sleep was also linked with a 60 per cent higher chance of night-time snacking on school nights, and 100 per cent higher chance of night-time munching on weekends.研究还发现这些青少年周一到周五晚上在学校吃零食的几率为60%，而周末在家吃零食的几率为100%，而这些都与不规律的睡眠时间有关。

Study lead author Fan He, of Penn State University College of Medicine, said: 'According to the data from our study, it's not how long you sleep that matters. 该研究的负责人，来自宾夕法尼亚州立大学医学院的何帆（音译）博士说：“从我们的研究数据中可以得出，睡眠时间的长短并不重要。”

'It's about day-to-day variations in how long you sleep.' “重要的是天与天之间睡眠时间长短的差异。”

Previous research has shown that teenagers who don't get enough sleep are at higher risk of obesity.以前有很多表明，睡眠不足的青少年肥胖的几率更高。

But most of those studies were based on self-reported sleep data.但是这些研究中有大多数采用的是被让调查者自我报告睡眠时间的方法。

The new study is the first to objectively measure the teenagers' sleeping pattern and physical activity for over a week in association with their eating habits in real life, instead of under laboratory conditions, Dr He said.而最新的这项研究是是第一次采用客观的方法测量青少年的睡眠模式及自然条件（而非实验室条件）下青少年一周内的生理活动同饮食习惯之间的关系。

The teenagers who took part in the study had an average age of 17 and wore actigraph bracelets, which measured their cycles of activity and rest over seven days to estimate how long they slept each night.参加这项研究的青少年平均年龄为17岁，他们被要求戴上可以记录活动变化的手镯，时间为7天，研究人员以此来估计他们每晚睡觉状况。

They answered a food frequency questionnaire to see how many calories and snacks, and how much protein, fat, and carbohydrates they regularly consumed in the previous year.另外他们还需要填写一份每天摄入食物次数的问卷，由此可以获得他们在去年的时间里平均每天吃多少零食、摄入多少卡路里、蛋白质、脂肪和碳水化合物等。

Then researchers analysed the relationships between sleep duration, day-to-day sleep variations and food intake. The results were adjusted for age, sex, race, and body mass index.之后研究人员分析了睡眠时间长短、每天的睡眠时间变化以及食物摄入量之间的关系，并将所得结果根据年龄、性别、种族、体重指数等进行校正。

The study showed that teenagers slept more at weekends than on weekdays.最后研究结果显示，这些青少年在周末的睡觉时间长于平时。

Researchers say one possible explanation for the effect of changes to sleep may be that getting less sleep may make a teenager more sedentary the next day, so they become a 'couch potato' snacking in front of the telly.研究人员称对此结果的其中一种解释是，睡眠时间变短可能会让人在第二天坐着的时间更长，所以他们都成了坐在电视机前吃零食的“沙发土豆”。

Another possibility is that shifts in sleep patterns result in a hormonal imbalance, causing teenagers to eat more.另一种可能是睡眠模式的改变导致激素分泌的不平衡，使青少年吃的更多了。

Scientists have long known the hormone leptin, acts like an appetite thermostat. 科学家们之前发现了一种叫做瘦蛋白的激素，它能够调节食欲。

As one of two 'hunger hormones' in the body, leptin works to decrease the appetite (its partner, ghrelin, increases appetite).作为人体内的饥饿激素之一，瘦蛋白能够减少食欲（它的搭档一种叫做脑肠肽的激素能够增强食欲）。

When a person has had enough to eat, their fat cells release leptin, which effectively dulls the appetite by instructing the brain that it's time to stop eating.如果一个人吃的东西已经足够多了，他的脂肪细胞就会释放瘦蛋白激素，它能告诉大脑不能再吃下去了，以此来有效抑制食欲。

But lack of sleep causes leptin levels to plummet, signaling your brain to eat more food.但是缺乏睡眠会导致瘦蛋白激素水平直线下降，这会给大脑发出“吃更多食物”的信号。

Simultaneously, ghrelin levels rise, increasing feelings of hunger.与此同时，脑肠肽激素水平升高，增强了饥饿的感觉。

Dr He said sleep duration itself might matter more if the teenagers were to be extremely sleep deprived, only sleeping four hours nightly for example.何博士称，如果被试被剥夺长时睡眠比如一晚只睡4个小时，那么睡眠时间的长短就会显得非常重要。

He said: 'It may be more important to have a regular sleep pattern than to sleep longer one day and shorter on another.他说：“但是有规律的睡眠模式更重要，那种一天睡得久一天睡得短的模式不可取。”

'These findings could help us better understand how obesity develops among young people.' “这些结果还能够帮我们更好地理解青少年中的肥胖是如何产生的。”
